docs.abstract: Dr Steven A Adelman letter on nicotine replacement therapy as powerful, underused tool in battle against tobacco dependency (Nov 17 article)
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Concerns about the effects of nicotine replacement therapy on the lining of blood vessels (''Nicotine's Image Takes a Turn for the Worse,'' Nov. 17) are legitimate and require research to determine their significance. But those of us who work with smokers to end their addiction are fully aware that nicotine replacement is a powerful, underused tool in the battle against tobacco dependence. Although the Agency for Health Policy and Research recommends routine use of nicotine replacement therapy for all smokers attempting to quit, the therapy is still being used relatively little. It is important that we continue to advocate the therapy, which doubles quit rates, without creating undue anxiety about possible subtle damage to blood vessels for those who are able to quit only by giving nicotine by a much less toxic delivery system. DR. STEVEN A. ADELMAN Boston
